review_body: Meh, it‚Äôs just OK. Not as accessibility user friendly as Facebook I really enjoy using Twitter, as a resource to connect with other authors, writers, and book lovers. However, because I barely have any eyesight, I have to use the voice over. I have seen the option in Settings, that allows Twitter to describe photos for blind and visually impaired users. I turn that setting on, and it doesn‚Äôt work. I also wish Twitter could describe a Animated giffs. Instead, my I-phone‚Äôs voiceover just says‚Äù I Animated gif‚Äù. There is also frequent bouts of glitchiness, between Twitter and my iPhone‚Äôs dictate button. The dictate button would work in my other apps, but when using it on Twitter, it sometimes does this funky 3-toned thing, and I have to hit it more than once to get it to transcribe what I say. Then other times when I use dictate on Twitter, it capitalizes the first letter of every single word. When I am lucky enough to notice this, I have to erase the whole tweet and type it all over again manually. That gets very tedious and annoying, because we voiceover users have two double tap each character and space as we type. My other complaints are, sometimes I can‚Äôt respond to others tweets that were posted from the Twitter web app. When I try to give a Like, or reply, it just bumps me back to my home page. Lastly, for some glitchy reason, my mobile app won‚Äôt let me play peoples videos. Especially not the ones that are posted on the Web app. So that is why I gave it three stars.

Real News When I Choose! When I was 27, my life fell apart. I was holding on by a thread. I was in such emotional pain, I also took on everyone else‚Äôs pain around me. Watching the news was so heartbreaking, it made day to day function even more difficult. I realized then, ‚ÄúThe News‚Äù was all about bringing all the horrors of life to the surface with a continual loop of the most sensational and horrific pain. I had to turn off the TV, cancel the news paper and even stop reading magazine covers.

Addicting in a Very Bad Way Twitter isn‚Äôt functional because you can‚Äôt easily remove followers.  Twitter doesn‚Äôt recognize that people have different needs over time. Many of us got on expressly to discuss politics. You follow and are followed by thousands of people.  Now you want to switch to your real name and focus on people doing a particular workout challenge or use the account for some other, less toxic reason.   You either have to delete the account, wait a period of time and start over (losing all your follows) or block every account you don‚Äôt want following you anymore, one at a time.  Twitter is full of bots supporting the right wing, far left extremists and fake accounts.  If you‚Äôre there for politics you can‚Äôt use your real name because you will be threatened and harassed. One person told me she could find out everything about me and ruin my life. Someone I follow used her real name and a harasser find out the name of the woman‚Äôs father‚Äôs business and filled yelp with negative reviews.   It can at times be a place for ‚Äúfriendship‚Äù or learning and even uplifting but it can also be a vile, depressing place.

Seeing that I haven‚Äôt logged out of twitter i was confused as to why they started to ask me this.i‚Äôve had this account for a long time and the email address i signed up with is one that i no longer had access to. because of this i was unable to reset my password. i tried emailing tech support but they gave me some excuse saying that they couldn‚Äôt verify the account and that there was no other way that they could do so. they‚Äôve never asked me to do so before and i am very upset with tech support. i would‚Äôve rather talk to an actual person to explain my problem than send an email that they took a long time to respond to. so now im stuck trying to figure out what my old password was because i don‚Äôt want to create a new account. its been 2 weeks since this happened and im very disappointed with their service and lack of communication.

App is great until you need support I‚Äôve had twitter for about 8 years now and recently have been locked out of my account due to age restriction. I‚Äôm currently well over the age to have an account but due to EU regulation twitter combatted this by locking accounts made by people under the age of 13. Being from America, I don‚Äôt understand why that should affect my account yet here we are. However that‚Äôs not my biggest issue. I‚Äôve never had to use twitter support until my account got locked out but because there is no email or account not on twitter for twitter support, there is no way for me to contact the support team for help. If I try to submit a form, it says my account is locked. I can‚Äôt send a message because my account is locked. I made a new account but it will direct me to send a message from my locked account, which then proceeds to tell me I can‚Äôt submit a form from my locked account. Twitter support needs a serious revamp considering it‚Äôs only useful for people with WORKING accounts; if my account worked then I wouldn‚Äôt need to contact twitter support in first place!

Perhaps this is a better way to get through to YOU I have been on Twitter for almost 10 years now, and I love the app. However, two weeks ago you sent me an email saying I supposedly violated the rules and I would be locked out of my account for 72 hours. Well guess what, it‚Äôs been 312 hours later and I‚Äôm still locked out with absolutely no contact from you whatsoever as to when I can get back in to my account!! I have tried several times filing an appeal as to the suspension, yet ZERO contact or answers from you AT ALL!! Did I say something harsh to someone, yes I admit that I did. I did NOT however promote any violence or supposed hate, or threaten someone‚Äôs life. I consider myself a conservative, and if that‚Äôs the problem you have, then just admit that‚Äôs the problem to me and everyone else and we can all move on. However if you allow a liberal or left leaning person to say whatever they want with no repercussions, then I‚Äôm afraid you are going to have a much bigger problem on your hands. So please, for the sake of humanity, just respond to me and tell me how long I‚Äôm going to be locked out for so at least I can move on.

Better than nothing In general, I like Twitter. I joined it to see for myself what our President has to say. Mostly I read news articles. I retweet them and sometimes comment on others‚Äô posts. I seldom receive comments, likes, etc for the last couple of months. Doing some research, I‚Äôve learned that my replies are hidden below a bar called ‚Äúshow more replies‚Äù. This means no one will see anything I post unless they take an extra step to click on that bar. Essentially, I‚Äôm being censored and this is common practice on Twitter. I don‚Äôt know why because I don‚Äôt curse, I‚Äôm not hateful or abusive, and I don‚Äôt post fake news. The biggest issue I have with Twitter is the lack of support. I‚Äôve reached out for help several times to address the censorship issue to no avail. No response and no guidance regarding this ‚Äúdeboosting‚Äù that happens to many people, particularly conservatives. Twitter is biased, but allows me to see with my own eyes what the President is saying rather than being fed propaganda by the ‚Äúfake news‚Äù MSM. So, at the end of the day, it‚Äôs better than nothing.

Very inconsistent in enforcing their own TOS I have noticed that ‚Äúverified accounts‚Äù, particularly of those espousing views of the far right, commit all kinds of egregious violations of terms of service, including harassment, threats, hateful conduct, doxxing, and in the case of at least one public official, intimidation of a witness, which is a felony. Yet Twitter allows these accounts to remain as subscribers; but if unknowns, particularly within the progressive community, peacefully express critical comments against even public officials (who should be prepared to accept them as part of their job), those unknowns get their accounts suspended! That double standard, coupled with CEO Jack Dorsey‚Äôs meeting with Trump, makes me wonder if he isn‚Äôt a Russian asset.

Locked out of my account I love twitter and I‚Äôve had my account for 6 years now, but recently i‚Äôve been locked out of my account. SUGGESTION: I would REALLY like a feature that allows you to block your friends from viewing your posts, but still allows you to view THEIR posts. I want this feature because often times, people who have mental health issues, or issues in general, they usually want to express their problems or grievances on some type of platform, but they don‚Äôt always want their friends to know what they‚Äôre going thru (for various reasons). They just want the autonomy to express themselves authentically. While the private feature allows you to keep your posts private, it doesn‚Äôt foster an environment that allows for communication with strangers who might possibly relate or know what you‚Äôre going through, which in turn promotes a community of encouragement and understanding.

A) they can distinguish and they choose not to, and b) if republicans are posting white supremacist content they should still be taken down even if they‚Äôre in the government.

They won‚Äôt give me my account back. I was tricked (don‚Äôt ask) into changing the date on my twitter account to one that did not meet the minimum age requirements. Twitter management, please fix this problem as I know I am not the only one experiencing it.

So far so good All things considered, Twitter is a magnificent phenomenon. The company seems to have gotten much better about its behavior toward its users. We all knew signing on that it has its rules. We agreed to them. In all fairness however, Twitter has also broken its own rules to the detriment of its guests, and has been a bad actor regarding its bias against profiles that may differ from the political opinions of those who work at twitter. That said, working with limitations often forces us in a good way to refine our thoughts more creatively, and subsequently more clearly. What a great thing for us all to have an outlet for our pain, confusion, humor, love of animals, joys... I‚Äôd like to see Milo Yiannopoulous and James Woods be allowed to return, and I‚Äôm sure there are others who were unjustly banned or suspended who we would be better to be back with us. Like I said, all things considered :)

Extremely disappointed about lack of customer service. I try to keep active on all of the accounts, not spam, keeping my head down even at the atrocities around me, from transphobia and homophobia, to pedophiles proudly showing off what they are, harassing people with no consequences! FIX THE NOTIFICATIONS! I used to use this app all day, everyday. It was my go to for just about every piece of news or information that interested me. But somewhere along the way it developed a bug that has driven me to the point of never opening it anymore. If you open the app it almost immediately tells you that you have a message. When you tap on the messages tab there is nothing there and the notification goes away. But if you then close the app, there is now a red bubble notification on the badge. Open the app again to see what it is and once again it says you have a message. And there‚Äôs nothing there!!! For someone with mild clinical OCD this is absolutely maddening. It‚Äôs to the point now where I won‚Äôt open the app at all.

I recently made another account and was on there for a while and then got suspended again. Once again, no email or anything. I thought it was just me but apparently this is happening FREQUENTLY TO MANY PEOPLE IVE SPOKEN TO FOR NO REASON.

Great App I‚Äôve been using Twitter since it first came out and I was so amazed at house much I could learn about what‚Äôs going on around the world in real time. It was a game changer back then and it still is now. Every social platform has bugs from time to time, ALL of them. That‚Äôs just how technology works. But I‚Äôll say Twitter has the best response time in regards to anything, not limited to fixing bugs in such a quick manner. It‚Äôs also the only social media platform that TRULY allows you free speech. They don‚Äôt take down offensive posts nearly as often as Instagram and Facebook, only if they cross a verrrryyyyy big line. Not saying that‚Äôs the type of Tweeter I am, I am all for equality and Twitter also has one of the most diverse users. Long story short üòÇüòÇüòÇ give this a try, it‚Äôs not what you‚Äôre used to, but it‚Äôs equally as awesome. ü§™ü§ìüôå

Overbanning, Censoring Speech, Where to Begin So I used to LIVE for Twitter. I would literally be locked into a Twitter session sometimes for over 4-5 hours at a time, back when it was just celebs promoting movies, books, music, etc ‚Äî the arts. NOW? It‚Äôs a Political Hyper-Echo Chamber that divides both sides even further, and dare I say, they‚Äôve gone so far as to basically begin the censorship that Chinese citizens face on a day to day basis. Why is my tweet defending myself, my views and way of life, any worse than others defending theirs? After they started doing the hard bans for multiple days, I jumped ship for good and I‚Äôll never go back. Twitter is a dying breed, as is most social media now. We now know, you guys just rake in money on ads and etc, while we sit around feeding your networks with content to keep it interesting, FOR FREE!! Where is the option to start monetizing my tweets? Overall, the app is suffering, the service is suffering, and it‚Äôs just not so great. They are VERY celebrity-protectionist, and they‚Äôre making the platform one that‚Äôs actually LESS inclusive for all, instead of more inclusive.

Twitter I love Twitter because i can see its potential. If the powers that be were not so afraid of it it could blossom into the greatest invention since the printing press. I would have given it five stars except I disagree with some of the unfair censorship. However, it far out does the others by trying to resist the forces thrown at it. I watched a Republican chastise Twitter Rep for not allowing CIA involvement to monitor for Russian disinformation. He also chastised them for not controlling the search result because Alex Jones( this before 2016 election) would show up at the top to often. I don‚Äôt watch him but was reminded how Hillary said if elected she would shut him down and Breitbart as they had no right  to exist. I was stunned and so I salute Jack for withstanding the pressure, for debating an independent journalist I admire.

Don't Bother Dowloading I've used Twitter for years and I just started having problems. One day randomly, my account was suspended without an explanation or email notifying me of this. The iPad App Bites! The iPad version is horrible compared to the iPhone version, thus why I am only giving the Twitter app a 2 star rating. (And yes, I have gone in to my Twitter data and updated my interests, but it doesn‚Äôt do anything and when I go back in a week later, the AI has added items back that I have removed.)

The best social media app. Hands down. Twitter is the perfect social media website to,  expresses yourself and connect with everyone around the globe. Likes and dislikes As a millennial having been born in the early 80‚Äôs I have the viewpoint from a world originally without the broad connection of the internet. Differences of Opinion Almost scored Twitter with 3 stars and have considered not using twitter at all due to the exaggerated negativity, foul and hateful language from some individuals who choose to follow some of the same people I do. Censorship never wins. Not ‚Äúfreedom of speech‚Äù friendly.   Banning and/or promoting users based on their political views, or religious views.  Double standards for individuals based on their ethnicity, skin color, Social Status, or Political affiliations. Not a very fair interface for the everyday individual; but I don‚Äôt mind a challenge. Slowly killing their users Twitter can be a very useful social media service in this day and age. Whether it be keeping up with friends and family, local news, celebrities, politics, or just straight memeing to your hearts desire. However, Twitter is slowly dying. At least in my opinion. They keep pushing updates to make it less user friendly, don‚Äôt actually follow through with banning people who abuse their terms of service (unless they‚Äôre a small account) and most of all, removing necessary APIs for third party apps to be able to work. I used third party apps for years because of the way Twitter handles their own native apps. They push ads on you (with no way to remove them. I‚Äôd pay a subscription fee for that), they track everything you do (albeit, not as bad as Facebook) and honestly, I think the most annoying issue of all of them, is the fact that THE IPAD APP IS JUST A BLOWN UP VERSION OF THE IPHONE APP! Give me MY timeline back When you decide to let ME control MY timeline I'll start using your app again, until then I'll be using a different app. I hate the "In case you missed it", and I don't want too see what everyone else likes, if I want to see that, I'll look at their profile. A feature I would love to see added... Great application. I use it a lot for personal & also professional usage. As part of my work, I make extensive usage of the list features. This would allow me to disable notifications from a number of accounts on my off days when I don‚Äôt need to be connected as much, but also give the ability to quickly turn on a list when I head back in to work or am working from home. I don‚Äôt know if anyone has ever requested this feature, but I sure would love to see it. Again, great application. Definitely my top social media choice.

Needs More Characters If you use Twitter for more than just retweeting and liking other people‚Äôs tweets- I‚Äôm sure you have come across the hindering effect that the very short character count has on unverified accounts. Twitter: A love/hate relationship Twitter is such an immersive app, whether you have a good or bad experience on the app, you can‚Äôt help but become a part of the experience. I definitely love this app, the global blog aspect that it has, keeps you coming back. Twitter is also a place where you can find news, social communities, and even follow( and sometimes even interact with) your favorite celebrities. The good aspects of Twitter heavily outweigh the bad; in my opinion. But on it‚Äôs bad days, Twitter can become very toxic. Opinions on this app can sometimes be misconstrued as fact, so when operating this app, be sure to have your facts together. Other than that, the app can sometimes become home, the level of immersion is unmatched by any other app; combining the great aspects of most of the other great social media apps around.

Dictation needs to be fixed badly. So before this recent update of the Twitter app for iOS, everything was working fine. Dictation was one of those things. Now, it seems that if you are visually impaired or not, you have to write out what you want to say unless you can do short hand. Even if I turn voiceover off, dictation still doesn‚Äôt work. I start to dictate what I want to say and then dictation turns itself off. I have called Apple about this issue, and Apple says that it‚Äôs not their issue. Which in fairness it‚Äôs not. Because dictation works everywhere else. I have even uninstalled the application, turned off the phone, turned on the phone again, and then went to re-download the app. I even signed in with my credentials and tried to dictate a test tweet. That didn‚Äôt work. Please fix this annoying bug for those who have visual impairments or different handicapped problems and also for those who have no visual issues whatsoever. I can‚Äôt even send support help questions because they do not get back to me.

Could use improvements I would like to be able to search through my followers by name to easily filter through as well as search on other people‚Äôs pages through their followers too. Worse all the time A truly awful application that they keep managing to make worse  in large and small ways. Kudos on the innovation required to make even the display of ‚Äúlikes‚Äù into the visual equivalent of a hovering mosquito! Twitter has one useful function ‚Äî displaying short, timely posts of a selected group of people in chronological order ‚Äî and they have been trying to destroy that one function for years. With the latest round of updates, I think they‚Äôve finally done it. Their concept of ‚Äúhome,‚Äù showing random  posts by random people in random order, reveals the developer‚Äôs true goal: chaos. They want nothing less than the destruction of order itself, and to make their point clear, they shuffle the posts *while you are reading them*. The only reasons I can see that twitter still exists is 1) it is the chosen platform of a raving would-be dictator, and 2) ‚Äúat least it‚Äôs not Facebook. Will their striving for chaos finally overcome the network effect, erasing them from our lives and memories? We can only hope.

Nice app but could be way better I like Twitter for the people on the platform and as a source for curated content. .The app, while functional, is confusing. A lot of this boils down to the UX.  The ux elements are crammed together - perhaps to show more rows of content. The end result is it‚Äôs not clear where to tap to do actions vs view them. For e.g, It‚Äôs not clear where to tap to view replies vs enter a reply.  Same with Likes.  Fb does a much better job of this by having separation in the ux for these two.  Finally, with posts with links - why not show a preview? Right now I don‚Äôt know what the link contains or if it send me to some malicious site.  Finally it‚Äôs not clear how to view topics by interests. Also for advanced features like moments, and lists - I have no idea what they are for and how to use them - make it clear. Getting these basics right will go a long way in making the site more useful for non power users.

review_body: Frustrating. This is so FRUSTRATING. It has happened to me too many times and I‚Äôm honestly tired of it. It‚Äôs ridiculous. Twitter really needs to change this because I doubt I‚Äôm the only one it‚Äôs happened to. I have done nothing  other than like posts, retweet posts, and follow others, and somehow I get my account locked??? I am absolutely TIRED of this.

App: fine. Service? Um... Selective enforcement of terms of service, lax measures against manipulative bots and harassment campaigns, and questionable algorithms amplifying voices based on outrage have led to a rapidly deteriorating beehive of a community. It remains an important tool for marginalized communities to connect with each other, but it feels like every pro has been counteracted and erased by a con, and then some. I am unsurprised that more and more high profile users are either leaving the platform or simply using it as an update blaster without true engagement.
Even more! I love Twitter! I feel that I can stay in contact with the world, not just my friends. But always I have the same problem: how can I find one past tweet?

I have met some interesting people here, as well. The big negative of Twitter is its horrible and readily apparent bias against conservatives. I know countless users who were suspended or shadow banned merely for stating their political opinions. I was one of those. On Twitter, the 1st Amendment applies only to the liberal and ultra left users. Twitter‚Äôs treatment of actor James Wood is shameful. As soon as a better option becomes available, I will be gone. Why don‚Äôt you folks clean up your act. This is the USA where freedom of speech is tantamount!

author_name: Heads I win, Tails you lose
review_body: If you like to update every week for no reason, this app is for you Had twitter for years. I used to like it. But then update after update after update. Buggy as of Recently I‚Äôve been using Twitter regularly for a little over a year now. I haven‚Äôt had any issues with anything unrelated to other users until recently, however. It‚Äôs starting to get annoying and I‚Äôd really like to see a fix for it. Thanks.
Steals information, breaks the law, impossible to delete This app is purely a system for collecting our personal information to be sold to companies for precise advertising targeting.
Bring back worldwide trends There‚Äôs something very big and messed Up happening on Twitter right now.

Good app, bad administrators. Wow. I‚Äôve had this app for 8 years and watched it go from cool, to a disastrous and divisive platform.  The twitter news is toxic, misleading, and irritating to someone who isn‚Äôt in the echo chamber of concentrated liberal circles. Consistently pushing certain hashtags while suppressing others. Whoever is running the administration needs some serious revaluation of what they are doing. My friend got suspended for having suspicious activity. Nothing he said was prejudice or racist. This happens consistently with people I follow. Hope to find a new platform soon that doesn‚Äôt suppress speech they don‚Äôt like (criticism of liberal ideologies and hypocrisy).
All good but minor bug to follow topic Great app no doubt and I really appreciate twitter for bringing new things to enhance UI and keep things new all the time.

The best place for meaningful discussions I love getting to know about the news and discussing important issues and topics with a truly wide and diverse audience. Now that Twitter has made the decision to forego all political campaign money for the sake of trying to protect our democracy in the face of existential threats posed by weaponized, automated messages targeted at individuals based on data about us that‚Äôs harvested and sold to those wanting to manipulate us, I‚Äôm an even more enthusiastic user.

Twitter is unreliable When someone uses email, a forum, slack, etc. they can read something and later go back to reread it. Not only is that simple functionality not available, but simply going to another app and returning puts you in a different place! I understand that it‚Äôs constantly updating, but i‚Äôm often moved to a completely different thread when i return. And since that thread has moved on, finding where i was becomes a ridiculously difficult task.

280 Characters are too much I absolutely love Twitter, I‚Äôve been addicted for years and have never had a problem. Although now that the character limit is 280, it‚Äôs just not the app it used to be. 140 characters was just enough. Twitter made its success on being short and blunt. It sparked creativity to be able to get your point across with a short concise message, and it made one liners all that much better. Now the character limit is way too long and too much to read It causes a loss in interest and makes the app unappealing. I vote to take the character count back down to 140.
Lists malfunction fixed! Updating my previous 2 star rating to a solid 4 star rating.  App works great now.

STOP Scrolling to the Top! The app used to open and stay where I left off. When new tweets posted it let me know there were new tweets but still kept my place in the timeline. Many have complained about this but somehow you still have a 4 star rating. Which makes sense. Why change the app to how your users want it when you can buy 5 star reviews. Why am I even writing this, it's not like you read these let alone care. Just as long as we keep using it (which you know we will)

Great concept I gave Twitter 3 stars because of censoring.  In the case of an open threat to life or limb I get it. You have provided us all with elective safety measures and I do appreciate that.  That is where the line should be drawn unless it is downright frighteningly threatening to users.
